to_address: "Speakup is a screen review system for Linux." <speakup@braille.uwo.ca>
subject: Re: ttsynth help: download problem
body:
Thanks for the gcc info.  I have the gcc 3.3.6-i486-1 so I guess this 
explains why the needed library isn't there.

So how do I find gcc-2.95 and build it without damaging my machine?  You
mentioned a discussion on this list regarding doing that.  Where is 
that?

Would it be possible for someone just to email the library to me?  I'm 
using the 2.6.13 kernel under Slackware 10.1.

Mike Keithley
